summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an FBI contact, requesting coordination to review images and videos from Jeffrey Epstein's devices for discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The email seeks to arrange a call to discuss logistics.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The case referenced in the email is the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, for which discovery materials from Jeffrey Epstein's devices are being reviewed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Images and videos from his devices are being reviewed for discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

connections.description: The document references the Maxwell case and the review of Epstein's devices, indicating their alleged association in criminal activity.

events.title: Coordination for discovery review
events.description: An AUSA emails an FBI contact to coordinate the review of images and videos from Jeffrey Epstein's devices for discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The FBI was involved in coordinating the review of images and videos from Jeffrey Epstein's devices for the Ghislaine Maxwell case discovery.
The email was sent by an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York on October 16, 2020.
The review of Epstein's devices was a logistical effort requiring coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI.
